intro: Euploca anderssonii, commonly known as the Andes euploca, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Euploca anderssonii is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
